WorkItem.ClosedComment: hosps said he resolved the issue.
WorkItem.Description: When you move your mouse from an ApplicationMenu item over to a SubMenuItem, the mouse tends to loses focus too quickly causing the submenu to closed before you have the chance to select any of the items.
WorkItem.Summary: WPFRibbon - MouseMove from ApplicationItem to SubItem

Comments.Message:
You may scratch this. 

As I played with this some more, I found that I was nesting RibbonApplicationMenuItems inside each other instead of inside a RibbonApplicationSplitMenuItem at the root. 

The delay appears to be working properly now.
Scratch my last. This problem appears to be intermittent.

More information on this issue. I am using a High DPI mouse (Logitech G5) with the refresh rate turned up to 500 times per sec. When I turn the refresh rate down, the problem diminishes (doesn't completely go away but is harder to trigger). There may only be a few pixels between the menu and submenu and with a high DPI mouse, it is picking up a mouse event when moving the cursor across.

Hi hosps,

Do you have this issue with normal WPF Menus or only with RibbonApplicationMenu?

Thanks,
Samantha
